result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond J. Magruder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is eligible for early release after 4 years upon application of the Agent.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution to individual victims before the insurance companies.

Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment or pursue GED/HSED or its equivalent, or any combination of the 2.
Defendant shall obtain his GED/HSED.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall not possess any illegal substances.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant shall have no contact directly or indirectly with Cody Malouf, JK's, Kenneth Sylvester, Terry McCarville or Mark Post.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall possess prescription medication only by valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed by physician.
Defendant shall use one (1) pharmacy and report to Agent new/changing medications and doctor appointments within 72 hours.
Credit 3 days, if probation is revoked.

timeConds.notes: Stayed - to be used at Agent's discretion.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: **Amended 9/12/18 to reflect 261 days of credit as shown below.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant to obtain and maintain full-time employment or pursue HS education or a combination of same.

Defendant shall not possess any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without DMV authorization.
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle with any alcohol or restricted controlled substances in his blood.
Defendant to have no contact directly or indirectly with JK's, Kenneth Sylvester, Cody Malouf, Mark Post or Terry McCarville.

Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall obtain prescriptions from only 1 pharmacy and take in the manner and method as prescribed by his physician. 
Defendant shall notify his Agent of any medical appointments or changes in prescriptions within 72 hours.
